alert.note: Alert for Northampton (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Beach Hazards Statement issued June 22 at 2:18AM EDT until June 22 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Rough surf conditions and a high risk of rip currents expected. * WHERE...In North Carolina, Eastern Currituck County. In Virginia, Northampton County. * WHEN...Through this evening. * IMPACTS...Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. NASSAWADOX CREEK AT BAYFORD VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 3.0 FT, MODERATE 3.5 FT, MAJOR 4.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.0 FT, MODERATE 1.5 FT, MAJOR 2.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 22/01 AM 3.6 1.6 1.8 2 MODERATE 22/01 PM 2.8 0.8 1.4 1 NONE 23/01 AM 2.7 0.7 1.1 1-2 NONE 23/03 PM 2.4 0.4 0.9 2 NONE 24/02 AM 2.5 0.5 0.9 1-2 NONE 24/03 PM 2.4 0.4 0.9 1 NONE KIPTOPEKE VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 4.5 FT, MODERATE 5.0 FT, MAJOR 5.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.5 FT, MODERATE 2.0 FT, MAJOR 2.5 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 22/12 PM 3.6 0.6 1.3 1 NONE 23/12 AM 3.6 0.6 1.0 1-2 NONE 23/01 PM 3.1 0.1 0.8 2 NONE 24/01 AM 3.3 0.3 0.8 1-2 NONE 24/02 PM 3.1 0.1 0.8 1 NONE OYSTER VA MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 7.0 FT, MODERATE 7.5 FT, MAJOR 8.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 2.4 FT, MODERATE 2.9 FT, MAJOR 3.9 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 22/12 PM 5.3 0.7 1.6 1 NONE 23/12 AM 6.1 1.5 1.3 1 NONE 23/01 PM 4.8 0.2 1.0 1 NONE 24/01 AM 5.7 1.1 1.0 1 NONE 24/02 PM 4.7 0.1 0.9 1 NONE COROLLA NC MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 5.5 FT, MODERATE 6.0 FT, MAJOR 6.5 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.8 FT, MODERATE 2.3 FT, MAJOR 2.8 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 22/11 AM 3.9 0.2 1.2 5 NONE 22/11 PM 4.2 0.5 0.9 3-4 NONE 23/12 PM 3.5 -0.2 0.7 3 NONE 24/12 AM 3.7 0.0 0.6 3 NONE 24/01 PM 3.5 -0.2 0.7 2 NONE &&
info.instruction: Life-threatening rip currents. If caught in a rip current, remain calm. Swim in a direction following the shoreline. If tired, float or tread water until out of the rip current. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help. Shore break occurs when waves break directly on the beach. It is extremely important to protect your head and neck whenever you are in breaking waves by keeping your hands in front of you at all times. Strong longshore currents can sweep swimmers and surfers into rip currents, piers, jetties and other hazardous areas. In many cases, the longshore current is strong enough to prevent swimmers from being able to keep their feet on the bottom making it difficult to return to shore.
